Package be.helha.interf_app.Service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
be.helha.interf_app.Service.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
Service class for managing and performing operations related to User entities. This class provides methods for saving users, logging in users, retrieving user information, updating user details, and deleting users.

Attributes:

  • userRepository: The repository used for accessing User data in the database.
  • authenticationManager: The authentication manager used for handling authentication operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      public UserService()

  • Method Details

    • saveUser

      public User saveUser(User user)
      Saves a new user to the repository with a default role of "ROLE_User". If a user with the given ID already exists, the user is not saved.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be saved.
      Returns:
      The saved user, or null if the user already exists.

    • login

      public LoginRequest login(LoginRequest loginRequest)
      Authenticates the user based on the login request and generates a JWT token for the user if the authentication is successful.

      If authentication fails (e.g., incorrect credentials or user not found), this method returns null.

      Parameters:
      loginRequest - The login request containing the user's credentials.
      Returns:
      The updated login request with the JWT token if authentication is successful, or null if authentication fails.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all users stored in the repository.
      Returns:
      A list of all users.

    • getUserById

      public Optional<User> getUserById(String id)
      Retrieves a user by their ID from the repository.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the user if found, or an empty Optional if not.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String id)
      Deletes a user by their ID from the repository.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user to be deleted.

    • getUserByEmail

      public Optional<User> getUserByEmail(String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email from the repository.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the user if found, or an empty Optional if not.

    • getUserByUsername

      public Optional<User> getUserByUsername(String username)
      Retrieves a user by their username from the repository.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the user if found, or an empty Optional if not.

    • updateUser

      public User updateUser(String id, User user)
      Updates an existing user in the repository. The method ensures that the user's role cannot be modified by unauthorized users.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user to be updated.
      user - The user object containing the new information.
      Returns:
      The updated user if the update is successful, or null if the user's role is being changed.
